programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Newlyweds Karen and John Leonard from Essex are on the brink of retirement. With the last of the six boys they have between them about to leave home, theyre looking for a new adventure and a complete change of lifestyle in the south of Gran Canaria.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Simon White and friend and neighbour Shirley Boyle are first to host at The Old Hall Country House in the picturesque village of Madeley in Cheshire. On arrival most of the guests are awed by the historical 16th century BandB. In the afternoon, Simon and Shirley take their guests tap dancing and in keeping with the five-star luxury to a private fine dining restaurant for dinner.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Its day two in the competition and the turn of cat-lover Eileen Finn to cater for her BandB competitors at the four-star Thornley House in Allendale, Northumbria. After being blown away by first hosts Simon and Shirley at the luxury Old Hall Country House, Eileen has her work cut out. Also, Eileens beloved and very large Maine Coon cats are not to all of her guests liking.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jessica and Adrian Rashleigh are third to host at their three bedroom establishment Chy Conyn in St Ives, on the beautiful Cornish coast. The hosts hope that what they lack for in size they will make up for in stunning surroundings. For the activity Jessica and Adrian take their guests on a magical mystery camper van tour of the local sights. At breakfast some of the guests struggle with the small breakfast room.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final hosts are Tim and Karen from The Cavendish in Bournemouth. The guests are initially impressed with the 16-bed `pink palace, but things go downhill when Simon and Shirley vigorously test their bed - and break it. Jessica and Adrian are worried that their room, situated right next to the front door, may mean a noisy night. Eileen however is delighted by the feline memorabilia left in her room as a special touch.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rivals reconvene for one last time to find out how much theyve been paid by their fellow BandB owners, and to sort out their differences. Simon White of Old Hall Country House is stunned by a generous overpayment, but Eileen Finn from the four-star Thornley is on the receiving end of some harsh criticism and some even harsher payments, and a shock underpayment leaves Tim from The Cavendish in Bournemouth reeling.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Southend-on-Sea, the first to host is dog-fancier executive PA Julie-Ann Rayner. Julie-Anns a dinner party veteran and has high hopes that her `taste of the Sea menu - with not one, but two fish courses - will have her guests hooked, assuming that they all like fish, that is. If her fishy feast doesnt go down a treat, Julie-Ann has some musical mayhem up her sleeve.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its grandmother Carols turn to host in Southend-on-Sea. Shes pretty confident in the kitchen, and her menu includes scallops and roast lamb.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: WA World Championship Athletics LIVE
programme.desc: Coverage continues of the first evening session of the 2025 World Athletics Championships as three gold medals are handed out. Ethiopias Gudaf Tsegay is back to defend her 10,000m crown, and despite missing much of the season though injury, Ryan Crouser has confirmed he will be in Tokyo and aiming to win the mens shot put for the third time in a row.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Cornwall, the call of the sea and Steve Brown beckon a young, water-loving couple who are looking to escape to the coastal county with their young daughter. They have £620,000 to spend on their new Cornish home. Steve also gets the chance to take to the water with a sailing school who support people of all abilities to develop their nautical know-how.

programme.title: Early Man

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: In a star-studded episode, some famous faces are put through their musical paces in this family special! Who will get the chance to win £10,000 for their chosen charity?

programme.desc: Sarah Mulkerrins presents highlights from the first day of the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, with medals being handed out in the men and womens 35km walks, the mens shot put and the womens 10,000m. programme.title: WA World Athletics Championships
programme.desc: The worlds fastest men and women in the world are on the track as Sarah Mulkerrins presents highlights of a busy second day of the World Athletics Championships from Tokyo. Its the finals of both the men and womens 100m, with Noah Lyles, Julien Alfred, Dina Asher-Smith and Zharnel Hughes all aiming for a place on the podium. Three other world champions will be crowned in the mens 10,000m, the womens discus and the womens long jump, and well reflect on the womens marathon.

programme.sub-title: Animated Specials: Gruesome Guide to Growing Up
programme.desc: Horrible Histories delves into the not-so-easy lives of children throughout history, from the strict parenting of ancient civilisations, to the terrible fights the young King Louis XIV had with his little brother.

programme.title: Early Man

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The time comes for one couple to flare out of Honeymoon Island, signalling the end of their relationship. Elsewhere, the couples swap partners for the day to gain some valuable insights into their marriages, resulting in some fiery exchanges on their return.

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: An intimacy crate washes up to help the honeymooners get personal. And when the couples spend the day apart at beach picnics, some are left reeling from shocking revelations, before a brand-new couple jump into stranded life together.

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: A crate containing the couples mobile phones washes ashore, revealing more than anyone bargained for. David drops a bombshell to Ini, causing shockwaves at the Couples Cove. And when night falls, Film Fest serves up some even bigger surprises for the honeymooners.

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: After being invited to a bar crawl on Khaosan Road, Zara gets under the skin of Bangkoks notorious red light district, Soi Cowboy - but filming is swiftly shut down by local bar owners and the police. When Zara meets Mike Yu, a young British expat living a life of luxury in the Thai capital, she realises theres more to the city than meets the eye. Meanwhile, a visit to the Bangkok Immigration Detention Centre exposes how easy it is to get caught on the wrong side of the law in Thailand.

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: In Asias sex capital, Pattaya, Zara meets British men chasing cheap thrills, before heading to Ko Phangan, an exotic island famed for its spirituality and beauty.

programme.desc: The Lemmings recover a jar of Yummy from an automatic distributor. However, before they can enjoy it, Grizzy confiscates the treat. In exchange, he leaves them the key ring that came as a gift.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a hidden mechanism on the Great Wall of China.

programme.title: Pokemon Horizons: The Series
programme.desc: Joined by Perrin, the Rising Volt Tacklers set out to find Kleavor on Tengu Mountain.

programme.title: Bros in Control
programme.desc: Star of socials Rhia gets set for sabotage following a race of teeny v tiny as Callum sets the lads The Big Tiny Bike Challenge.

programme.title: Gladiators: Epic Pranks
programme.desc: Nitro and Phantom prank Fire at a kids birthday party! The rest of the Gladiators have fun behind-the-scenes and pranking the audience at Sheffield Arena.

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.sub-title: Main Show: Gaming Top Tips and Joels Toughest Challenge Yet
programme.desc: Online gamers Yammy and Slogo give gaming masterclasses on `Minecraft and `Roblox.

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: News magazine keeping young viewers up to date with the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

programme.title: Gardeners World
programme.desc: Monty is harvesting sweetcorn. Toby visits a magical garden in Wiltshire. Frances is in a Cornish village to find out how pioneering technology is creating beautiful borders for pollinators. A self-taught grower is transforming her allotment.

programme.title: WA World Championship Athletics LIVE
programme.desc: The first medals on the track and in the field are handed out at the National Stadium in Tokyo as day one of the World Athletics Championships reaches its conclusion. After missing the whole of last season through injury, Great Britains Jazmin Sawyers is in action, aiming to qualify for the womens long jump final tomorrow.

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Join Alex Scott and guests to kick off your footballing weekend. We preview the Premier League action, including the Manchester derby, and discuss issues around the game, with detailed analysis from an expert panel.

programme.title: Womens Rugby World Cup LIVE
programme.desc: Coverage of the first quarter-final of the Womens Rugby World Cup 2025.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King continue their culinary journey through time, celebrating British Food. Here, the duo explore the incredible influence the Monarchy has had over the food we eat, past and present. Dave and Si create a modern version of the classic Coronation Chicken and create a sumptuous beef dish named after Prince Albert. They also meet food historian Ivan Day and recreate dishes from the coronati.

programme.title: Womens Rugby World Cup LIVE
programme.desc: Coverage of the second quarter-final of the Womens Rugby World Cup 2025.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The show comes from Dover Castle in Kent. Antique experts Catherine Southon and Jonathan Pratt search for items to take off to auction. Catherine falls for a colourful brooch and Jonathan unearths a horn beaker used by Winston Churchill. Paul Martin uncovers the story of Dover Castles secret tunnels.

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: The worlds greatest classical music party gets under way from the Royal Albert Hall, with soprano Louise Alder and the last ever performance from star trumpeter Alison Balsom.

programme.title: Iron Maiden: Live in Concert
programme.desc: A 60-minute concert filmed in different cities around the world in early 2008, featuring songs such as Fear of the Dark, Wasted Years, Number of the Beast and Hallowed Be Thy Name.

programme.title: Iron Maiden: Flight 666
programme.desc: The first leg of Iron Maidens Somewhere Back in Time world tour, which took them around the planet, playing 23 concerts on five continents in just 45 days.

programme.title: WA World Athletics Championships LIVE
programme.desc: Day 2 of the World Athletics Championships begins with the womens marathon, which for the first time starts and finishes in the National Stadium in Tokyo. Elsewhere, Great Britains Josh Kerr begins the defence of his 1500m world title in the heats, and the womens sprint hurdlers are also in action in qualifying.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Take a Hike
programme.desc: The weeks walks take place in stunning north west Wales. Four million people visit the region each year to enjoy its beautiful lakes and coastlines, as well as the challenging Snowdonia mountain range.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Sammi Kinghorn trace the pawprints of a river legend - Tarka the Otter, to explore how the people of North Devon have helped the Eurasian otter claw back from near-extinction.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The BBCs Breakfast programme features the latest news, sport, business, weather and other items on a daily basis.

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: At Beechgrove Garden, Lizzie and Brian return to the project of creating a new garden in memory of presenter Jim McColl, who passed away last year. Jims favourite trees, acers, are being planted.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Dave and Si explore how our love affair with bread has evolved over centuries. With their unique banter and camaraderie, they try their hand at Bagel making; create their own version of Summer Pudding and make a delicious soup and roll combo.

programme.title: WA World Championship Athletics LIVE
programme.desc: Five world champions are crowned on the second day of the World Athletics Championships from Tokyo as the fastest men and women in the world take to the track. After winning Olympic silver in Paris 2024, Matthew Hudson-Smith starts his campaign for a first world title as he lines up in the heats of the mens 400 metres. Great Britains world indoor champion Amber Anning is in action in qualifying for the womens 400m.

programme.title: Womens Rugby World Cup LIVE
programme.desc: Coverage of the third quarter-final of the Womens Rugby World Cup 2025.

programme.title: Brief Encounter
programme.desc: Housewife Laura Jesson meets Dr Alec Harvey at a railway station cafe and there is a spark. While both are married, they are tempted to adultery before they realise their marriages are more important than the fleeting happiness they may find together.

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Chris Packham explores what enables birds of prey to rule the aerial roost. Their ability to dominate their fellow birds in terms of strength, manoeuvrability and speed, is down to a combination of anatomical and physiological adaptations.

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Its the semi-final of the Great British Sewing Bee, and three challenges stand between the sewers and the final: plus fours, polo shirts and 1920s-inspired party outfits.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team presents from Culzean Castle on the west coast of Scotland. Experts Anita Manning and Natasha Raskin Sharp are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction. A watercolour with a local connection catches Anita?s eye, while Natasha is drawn to a gorgeous handwoven blanket. Paul Martin explores a hidden part of Culzean?s history, uncovering the tales of smugglers working the coastline in the caves beneath the castle walls.

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: A frantic mother alerts the lifeguards after six teenagers are cut off by the tide. The Anstruther crew race to the rescue of a female paddleboarder. The reports of a clothed person entering the water lead the Selsey crew to a late-night search.

programme.title: Rob and Rylans Passage to India
programme.desc: In Delhi, Rob and Rylan discover a tomb with a view, encounter a billionaire art collector, attempt their own rap performance, and try the ancient art of puppetry.

programme.title: Tár
programme.desc: Renowned musician Lydia Tár is days away from recording the symphony that will elevate her career. When all elements seem to conspire against her, Lydias adopted daughter Petra becomes an integral emotional support for her struggling mother.

programme.title: International T20 Cricket
programme.desc: Highlights of the third game of the T20 series between England and South Africa.

programme.title: The Guest
programme.desc: Ria faces the police while trying to pick up the pieces with Lee. But that will mean cutting Fran off entirely. Can she ever go back to her old life?

programme.title: Here We Go
programme.desc: Paul is going to be Altas godfather, but only if he gets himself baptised first.

programme.title: Chess Masters: The Endgame
programme.desc: The four finalists return for the last time to the Great Hall, ready to be put through their chess-playing paces like never before. Who will lift the winners trophy?

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Current affairs programme, featuring interviews and investigative reports on all aspects of life in Britain.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.desc: Simon White and friend and neighbour Shirley Boyle are first to host at The Old Hall Country House in the picturesque village of Madeley in Cheshire. On arrival most of the guests are awed by the historical 16th century BandB. In the afternoon, Simon and Shirley take their guests tap dancing and in keeping with the five-star luxury to a private fine dining restaurant for dinner.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Its day two in the competition and the turn of cat-lover Eileen Finn to cater for her BandB competitors at the four-star Thornley House in Allendale, Northumbria. After being blown away by first hosts Simon and Shirley at the luxury Old Hall Country House, Eileen has her work cut out. Also, Eileens beloved and very large Maine Coon cats are not to all of her guests liking.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jessica and Adrian Rashleigh are third to host at their three bedroom establishment Chy Conyn in St Ives, on the beautiful Cornish coast. The hosts hope that what they lack for in size they will make up for in stunning surroundings. For the activity Jessica and Adrian take their guests on a magical mystery camper van tour of the local sights. At breakfast some of the guests struggle with the small breakfast room.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final hosts are Tim and Karen from The Cavendish in Bournemouth. The guests are initially impressed with the 16-bed `pink palace, but things go downhill when Simon and Shirley vigorously test their bed - and break it. Jessica and Adrian are worried that their room, situated right next to the front door, may mean a noisy night. Eileen however is delighted by the feline memorabilia left in her room as a special touch.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rivals reconvene for one last time to find out how much theyve been paid by their fellow BandB owners, and to sort out their differences. Simon White of Old Hall Country House is stunned by a generous overpayment, but Eileen Finn from the four-star Thornley is on the receiving end of some harsh criticism and some even harsher payments, and a shock underpayment leaves Tim from The Cavendish in Bournemouth reeling.

programme.title: Cheers
programme.sub-title: Where Have All the Floorboards Gone?
programme.desc: Carla fears that Boston Celtics forward Kevin McHale is turning into one of the bar bunch. Meanwhile, Lilith gets a new hairdo.

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Sam dispatches Carla to get revenge on John Allen Hill - on horseback, and Cliff suffers from pony distress.

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Henri upsets Woodys apple cart by proposing to Kelly, and Frasier turns to the Orient for pain relief.

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Rebecca urges Sam to see a fertility specialist, and Frasier faces his own mortality.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray urges Debra to go dancing with Robert and becomes increasingly jealous of the situation.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert moves into Rays basement office so he and Amy can have some private time.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The new station manager, Kate Costas, orders Frasier to make major changes in his show.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Their decision to work together makes Martin think Frasier and Niles both need therapy.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer reminisces about the Be Sharps, the barbershop quartet he was in with Barney, Apu and Principal Skinner.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: When Lisa taunts Bart about his inability to keep a girlfriend, he convinces the family to visit New York City to find Mary Spuckler.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: More professional restaurateurs compete to win the £1000 prize. A modern twist on Indian cooking in Darlington takes on a vegan restaurant in Middlesbrough and a traditional Indian in Hartlepool.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Caroline and Gary fulfil their dream of owning a house in Spain for regular getaways to the countryside and villages of Valencia province. Jasmine shows them five fantastic options for their budget of £150,000.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George transforms a rusty lift into a cabin in the sky, and heads to Denmark to visit a modern Viking longhouse. Plus: the pinkest thing to ever appear on the show.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Amanda and Annette want a spacious futureproof bungalow in a serene setting, whereas first time buyers Danit and Rafi are after a 1-bed flat close to the buzz of Brighton and Hove.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie revisits Kathleen and Tom, whose Newcastle home was a battleground. When Phil last visited, theyd jumped ship. Have they got the renovation bug again?

programme.title: Worst House on the Street
programme.desc: To get onto the property ladder, best mates Brad and Billy have bought their first place together: a run-down house in Coventry. Scarlette and Stuart help them turn it into a home.

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Includes sport and weather.

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: When the Federation receives a distress signal from planet Vulcan during a hearing to decide whether Kirk has cheated on his final test at the academy, his friend Dr McCoy sneaks him aboard the USS Enterprise as it sets out on its maiden voyage.

programme.title: Britains Railway Empire in Colour
programme.desc: Celebrating the 200th anniversary of the birth of rail, experts and enthusiasts explore the story of how Britain gave railways to the world - featuring an extraordinary photo archive.

programme.title: The Popes Exorcist
programme.desc: Father Gabriele Amorth, chief exorcist for the Vatican, battles Satan and innocent-possessing demons. A detailed portrait of a priest who performed more than 100,000 exorcisms in his lifetime.

programme.title: The Last Stand
programme.desc: A sheriff must take matters into his own hands when a notorious drug lord escapes from FBI custody and comes speeding toward a showdown in the lawmans quiet border town.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The co-owners of South Brooklyn Foundry dont see eye-to-eye, causing communication to grow toxic while the restaurant falls into more debt; Gordon Ramsay steps in to reassess the Brooklyn eaterys priorities and straighten out the finances.

programme.title: Huge Homes with Hugh Dennis
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis visits a fun-packed modern city mansion with an interior slide and a firefighters pole, an arty Welsh 16th-century manor house, and a 40-room stately home preparing for the new generation to move in.

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: In the Midlands, Sandi takes comedian Rosie Jones to a unique eco-lodge complete with a disco bathroom, a stylishly rebooted 70s beach house and a charming hideaway known as the Wheelwrights Shop.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.sub-title: Double Decker Retreat and Boat Hotel
programme.desc: George meets carpenter Adam, who wants to turn a 30-year-old double decker bus into a luxury holiday retreat. George also visits a couple who have given up their jobs and thrown their life savings into designing a boat hotel.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.sub-title: Double Decker Retreat and Boat Hotel
programme.desc: George meets carpenter Adam, who wants to turn a 30-year-old double decker bus into a luxury holiday retreat. George also visits a couple who have given up their jobs and thrown their life savings into designing a boat hotel.

programme.title: Gair Kaanooni
programme.desc: When police officer Kapil Khanna discovers that his son was abducted at birth, and switched with a girl, he spends the next 20 years trying to track down his missing son, and finally finds him living with his enemy.

programme.title: Gair Kaanooni
programme.desc: When police officer Kapil Khanna discovers that his son was abducted at birth, and switched with a girl, he spends the next 20 years trying to track down his missing son, and finally finds him living with his enemy.

programme.title: Beta
programme.desc: After the death of his mother, Rajus father re-marries, but his stepmother is only after the familys money. When Raju eventually marries, his wife tries to make him realise what kind of woman his stepmother is.

programme.title: Baghban
programme.desc: Raj Malhotra and his wife Pooja have raised a family of four sons who are now nicely settled in their respective professions, but when Raj and Pooja decide to retire, none of their sons are willing to take care of them.

programme.title: Bajrangi Bhaijaan
programme.desc: A young mute girl from Pakistan loses herself in India with no way to head back. A devoted man with a magnanimous spirit undertakes the task to get her back to her motherland and unite her with her family.

programme.title: Aan -Men at Work
programme.desc: Police officer Hari Om Patnaik attempts to end corruption among his colleagues, who often ignore the criminal conducts of the major crime bosses in Mumbai.

programme.title: Aiyyaa
programme.desc: A woman who sees her life as a masala-movie goes on the hunt for her dream man.

programme.title: Aiyyaa

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.
programme.desc: Joey is excited about his audition for a major television action series about a man and his crimefighting robot, but Chandler almost ruins everything.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Meets Elizabeths Dad
programme.desc: Ross fails to impress his girlfriends father who proves tricky to get on with, and Phoebe makes Chandler and Monica paranoid by chronicling their every move in a supposedly fictional book she is writing.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Cruise TV with LoveitBookit
programme.desc: A definitive one-stop shop for all things cruise, bringing you the hottest destinations and the latest deals to ensure that your next cruise ship holiday is your greatest one yet.

programme.title: Michael McIntyres Big Show
programme.desc: Michael is joined by singing superstars Michael Buble and chart-topper Rita Ora. Husband and wife presenters Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford take part in a double Send to All, and Michael is in Essex for The Midnight Gameshow.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Without the Ski Trip
programme.desc: Ross and Rachel have been fighting for the groups attention since the break up. Rachel invites everyone except Ross to her family cabin in the mountains, but on the way to the cabin, they run out of petrol. Everyone wants to call Ross for help, but Rachel wont let them.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Hypnosis Tape
programme.desc: Phoebe is upset when her 18-year-old half-brother, Frank Jr, wants to marry his attractive home economics teacher, who is more than 25 years older than him. Elsewhere, Monica receives a tip from an admirer worth a small fortune, and a hypnosis tape intended to assist Chandler give up smoking has a rather strange effect on him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Tiny T-Shirt
programme.desc: Rachels former colleague Mark asks her out on a date. When Rachel invites Ross to her apartment, he thinks she wants to get back together, but she just wants to return his things. Later, as Rachel and Mark return from their date, Ross spies on them through the peephole of Joey and Chandlers door. Meanwhile, Monica dates a millionaire, and Joey is cast in a play and clashes with the female lead.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica inherits a beautiful dollhouse that is too elaborate to play with, so Phoebe makes her own, but it meets a sad end. Meanwhile, Joey thinks hes found his true love, and Rachels boss dates Chandler, placing her in a dangerous situation.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With a Chick and a Duck
programme.desc: When Monicas millionaire friend Pete buys a restaurant and asks Monica to be the head chef, she is faced with a difficult decision. Meanwhile, Ross makes a sacrifice for Rachel, and Joey buys Chandler an unusual pet.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The friends go to the opening night of one of Joeys plays. When Rachel finds out that Ross is bringing a date, she finds one of her own. Ross tries to convince Rachel that her date is mentally unbalanced. Meanwhile, Joeys play gets terrible reviews, but his co-star provides some comfort.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross develops a skin growth that doctors cant identify.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Ultimate Fighting Champion
programme.desc: Monica finds herself dating a guy who wants to be the Ultimate Fighting Champion. Meanwhile, Chandler finds his male bosss attentions just a little too friendly, and the group overhear a scandalous conversation at Central Perk.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe invites everyone to stay at her massage clients beach house for the weekend. Phoebe meets someone who knows details about her family, Rachel expresses her jealousy of Ross uninhibited girlfriend, and Joey nags the friends into agreeing to play a party game that requires the participants to gradually take off items of clothing.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross is dating Rachel again but hates what he had to do to get back together, while Phoebe and her real mother, Phoebe Snr, get to know each other better. Meanwhile, Monica is badly stung by a jellyfish and has to resort to drastic measures to relieve the pain.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler and Joey lose all their furniture, Monica finds that one date with her high-school heartthrob is more than enough, and Ross plays tricks on Rachel following their break-up. Elsewhere, Phoebe is temporarily convinced that a cat is the reincarnation of her dead adoptive mother Lily.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler has a brief fling with Rachels boss Joanna which leaves him handcuffed without his trousers in her office. Meanwhile, Joey can only afford one book in an encyclopaedia set, and Monica caters a party for her mother.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Ballroom Dancing
programme.desc: Joey argues with the building superintendent Treegar and ends up having to help him practise ballroom dancing. Meanwhile, Ross and Chandler cant get out of their gym membership even though neither of them wants to exercise, and Phoebe loses her massage job for kissing a client.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Joeys New Girlfriend
programme.desc: Chandler falls for Joeys new date, Ross discovers that the woman that he thinks hes dating actually thinks hes the babysitter, Rachels new college boyfriend steals, and Phoebe tries to re-catch a cold to improve her singing voice.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Dirty Girl
programme.desc: Phoebe and Monica decide to go into business together after they cater a funeral where the widow tries not to pay, and Ross date with the beautiful Cheryl goes awry when he kills a rat in her filthy apartment.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Crosses the Line
programme.desc: Chandler finally confesses to his feelings for Kathy just after she splits up with Joey, Ross rediscovers his hopeless musical skills on the keyboard which Phoebe alone appreciates, and Chandler buys new furniture for the apartment since the robbery left them with just the canoe, chick and duck.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Chandler in a Box
programme.desc: The friends have a Thanksgiving meal together, Monica is reminded of Richard when she tries to kiss his son, and Joey frees Chandler from the box that hes being kept in to stop Kathy leaving him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Theyre Going to Party!
programme.desc: Monica upsets Phoebe by stopping the catering business before it has started after she gets the head chef job at a restaurant where the staff all hate her, and Rachels boss is killed in a car accident before she can make Rachel a junior buyer.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Girl From Poughkeepsie
programme.desc: Ross struggles to maintain a long-distance relationship, Chandlers well-intended attempts to get Rachel a date seem to miss the mark, and Monicas plan to assert some authority at her new restaurant goes awry.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebes half-brother makes an astounding announcement and a thought-provoking request, while Joey finds himself in a class struggle.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Theyll be travelling from their home in Essex all the way to the Amalfi Coast in Italy, but the first stop on their road trip is the Netherlands, where they try out one of the countrys oldest sports, canal jumping. The action continues when the pair don lycra for a spot of velodrome track cycling alongside a world champion.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Bradley and Barney Walsh continue their European adventure in Germany. They head to the city of Frankfurt, where Brad is literally pushed to the edge as he attempts to abseil down the side of a building, facing forwards. The boys also make a stop at a bratwurst-themed hotel, and soak up some local Bavarian culture when they have a go at finger wrestling. The pair finish off their time in Germany with a wet and wild adventure in the mountains.

programme.title: Michael McIntyres Big Show
programme.desc: Michael is joined by singing superstars Michael Buble and chart-topper Rita Ora. Husband and wife presenters Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford take part in a double Send to All, and Michael is in Essex for The Midnight Gameshow.

programme.title: Zombieland
programme.desc: Columbus and Tallahassee have orchestrated a way to survive a world overrun by zombies. programme.desc: Joey is excited about his audition for a major television action series about a man and his crimefighting robot, but Chandler almost ruins everything.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Meets Elizabeths Dad
programme.desc: Ross fails to impress his girlfriends father who proves tricky to get on with, and Phoebe makes Chandler and Monica paranoid by chronicling their every move in a supposedly fictional book she is writing.

programme.title: Michael McIntyres Big Show
programme.desc: Michael is joined by singing superstars Michael Buble and chart-topper Rita Ora. Husband and wife presenters Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford take part in a double Send to All, and Michael is in Essex for The Midnight Gameshow.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Without the Ski Trip
programme.desc: Ross and Rachel have been fighting for the groups attention since the break up. Rachel invites everyone except Ross to her family cabin in the mountains, but on the way to the cabin, they run out of petrol. Everyone wants to call Ross for help, but Rachel wont let them.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Hypnosis Tape
programme.desc: Phoebe is upset when her 18-year-old half-brother, Frank Jr, wants to marry his attractive home economics teacher, who is more than 25 years older than him. Elsewhere, Monica receives a tip from an admirer worth a small fortune, and a hypnosis tape intended to assist Chandler give up smoking has a rather strange effect on him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Tiny T-Shirt
programme.desc: Rachels former colleague Mark asks her out on a date. When Rachel invites Ross to her apartment, he thinks she wants to get back together, but she just wants to return his things. Later, as Rachel and Mark return from their date, Ross spies on them through the peephole of Joey and Chandlers door. Meanwhile, Monica dates a millionaire, and Joey is cast in a play and clashes with the female lead.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica inherits a beautiful dollhouse that is too elaborate to play with, so Phoebe makes her own, but it meets a sad end. Meanwhile, Joey thinks hes found his true love, and Rachels boss dates Chandler, placing her in a dangerous situation.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With a Chick and a Duck
programme.desc: When Monicas millionaire friend Pete buys a restaurant and asks Monica to be the head chef, she is faced with a difficult decision. Meanwhile, Ross makes a sacrifice for Rachel, and Joey buys Chandler an unusual pet.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The friends go to the opening night of one of Joeys plays. When Rachel finds out that Ross is bringing a date, she finds one of her own. Ross tries to convince Rachel that her date is mentally unbalanced. Meanwhile, Joeys play gets terrible reviews, but his co-star provides some comfort.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross develops a skin growth that doctors cant identify.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Ultimate Fighting Champion
programme.desc: Monica finds herself dating a guy who wants to be the Ultimate Fighting Champion. Meanwhile, Chandler finds his male bosss attentions just a little too friendly, and the group overhear a scandalous conversation at Central Perk.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe invites everyone to stay at her massage clients beach house for the weekend. Phoebe meets someone who knows details about her family, Rachel expresses her jealousy of Ross uninhibited girlfriend, and Joey nags the friends into agreeing to play a party game that requires the participants to gradually take off items of clothing.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross is dating Rachel again but hates what he had to do to get back together, while Phoebe and her real mother, Phoebe Snr, get to know each other better. Meanwhile, Monica is badly stung by a jellyfish and has to resort to drastic measures to relieve the pain.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler and Joey lose all their furniture, Monica finds that one date with her high-school heartthrob is more than enough, and Ross plays tricks on Rachel following their break-up. Elsewhere, Phoebe is temporarily convinced that a cat is the reincarnation of her dead adoptive mother Lily.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler has a brief fling with Rachels boss Joanna which leaves him handcuffed without his trousers in her office. Meanwhile, Joey can only afford one book in an encyclopaedia set, and Monica caters a party for her mother.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Ballroom Dancing
programme.desc: Joey argues with the building superintendent Treegar and ends up having to help him practise ballroom dancing. Meanwhile, Ross and Chandler cant get out of their gym membership even though neither of them wants to exercise, and Phoebe loses her massage job for kissing a client.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Joeys New Girlfriend
programme.desc: Chandler falls for Joeys new date, Ross discovers that the woman that he thinks hes dating actually thinks hes the babysitter, Rachels new college boyfriend steals, and Phoebe tries to re-catch a cold to improve her singing voice.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Dirty Girl
programme.desc: Phoebe and Monica decide to go into business together after they cater a funeral where the widow tries not to pay, and Ross date with the beautiful Cheryl goes awry when he kills a rat in her filthy apartment.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Crosses the Line
programme.desc: Chandler finally confesses to his feelings for Kathy just after she splits up with Joey, Ross rediscovers his hopeless musical skills on the keyboard which Phoebe alone appreciates, and Chandler buys new furniture for the apartment since the robbery left them with just the canoe, chick and duck.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Chandler in a Box
programme.desc: The friends have a Thanksgiving meal together, Monica is reminded of Richard when she tries to kiss his son, and Joey frees Chandler from the box that hes being kept in to stop Kathy leaving him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Theyre Going to Party!
programme.desc: Monica upsets Phoebe by stopping the catering business before it has started after she gets the head chef job at a restaurant where the staff all hate her, and Rachels boss is killed in a car accident before she can make Rachel a junior buyer.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Girl From Poughkeepsie
programme.desc: Ross struggles to maintain a long-distance relationship, Chandlers well-intended attempts to get Rachel a date seem to miss the mark, and Monicas plan to assert some authority at her new restaurant goes awry.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebes half-brother makes an astounding announcement and a thought-provoking request, while Joey finds himself in a class struggle.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Theyll be travelling from their home in Essex all the way to the Amalfi Coast in Italy, but the first stop on their road trip is the Netherlands, where they try out one of the countrys oldest sports, canal jumping. The action continues when the pair don lycra for a spot of velodrome track cycling alongside a world champion.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Bradley and Barney Walsh continue their European adventure in Germany. They head to the city of Frankfurt, where Brad is literally pushed to the edge as he attempts to abseil down the side of a building, facing forwards. The boys also make a stop at a bratwurst-themed hotel, and soak up some local Bavarian culture when they have a go at finger wrestling. The pair finish off their time in Germany with a wet and wild adventure in the mountains.

programme.desc: Tensions explode on the Tomcod Claim; Chris takes radical action against a dredge he believes is jumping his claim; when a massive explosion blows a hole in the Mistress, Kris scrambles to save his livelihood.

programme.title: In the Eye of the Storm
programme.desc: Hundreds of cameras capture Hurricane Ida as the Category 4 storm slams the Louisiana coast in 2021, but when the superstorm shifts to the Northeast, eyewitnesses film harrowing encounters with tornadoes and flooding all the way to New York City.

programme.title: Marooned With Ed Stafford
programme.desc: Adventurer Ed Stafford has walked the length of the Amazon River - he is the first person to accomplish that - and survived alone for 60 days on a desert island near Fiji (a feat chronicled in `Naked Castaway), so perhaps the challenges presented in `Marooned arent that daunting. Filmed in Venezuelas Gran Sabana mountains, Botswanas Okavango Delta, Romanias Carpathian Mountains, the Western Australia coast, and Borneos Brunei jungles, the five hourlong episodes see Stafford - a former British Army captain - attempt to last ten days in the harsh environments with nothing more than a camera. Viewers are provided a fly-on-the-wall perspective as Ed tries to find food, make fire, process water to drink, and build a shelter - among many other life-saving challenges.

programme.title: Expedition Bigfoot
programme.desc: Bryce, Mireya, Russell and Biko converge at the high-activity area in "The Fork," which is equipped with state-of-the-art tech; as the interceptor drone and seismic tripwire activate, the team is led to a discovery theyve never seen before.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they keep the worlds tallest twin towers clean? How do they make a jigsaw where every piece is unique? And, how do they craft Olympic level hockey sticks?

programme.title: How Do They Do It?

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Guess Whos Coming to Criticize Dinner

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer causes an incident at the nuclear power plant, radiation from X-rays gives Bart and Lisa superpowers, and Flanders is killed.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Bart grow a highly addictive cross between tobacco and a tomato after moving to an old farm.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: After Homer becomes a celebrity by bowling a perfect game, he guest stars on `The Springfield Squares.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Andrea and Stephan, mother and son, roll up for an evening of double dating. Seventy-year-old Diane refuses to let age get in the way of finding love. And bagpipe instructor Adam tries get back on song with fellow Scot Conor.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Chocolate expert Angus meets glam chocolate-lover Justine. Two fashionistas bond over a shared Harry Styles fixation. And sparks fly when a writer and a rock singer meet.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldons well-organised world is turned upside down when he learns that the barber who has cut his hair for years has passed away. As his orderly routines descend into chaos, he is forced to act like a hippy in order to match his shaggy new hairstyle. Meanwhile, Howard is sent to Houston for the gruelling NASA training programme and shares horrific stories about his experiences with Bernadette via Skype.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy gets upset with Sheldon when he breaks his promise to accompany her to her aunts birthday party and instead opts to join the guys for a `Star Wars video game marathon lasting the entire weekend. Later, Penny convinces Amy that she should confront Sheldon about the matter and demand an apology.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Desperate to find a `plus one to take to a wedding, Raj finally gives up and asks his parents to set him up with a date. Meanwhile, Penny buys Leonard and Sheldon some `Star Trek memorabilia, but she is irked when they refuse to play with the toys in case their value is diminished by removing them from the packaging.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam is torn between following Beverlys rules when it comes to off-campus lunch or going to the mall food court with his friends. After using Barrys college ID to get food at the dorm, Geoff becomes the student Barry wishes he could be.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam and Murray dont want to go on a camping trip, so father and son create a film faking it. Erica joins an all-girl a cappella group and learns an important lesson after taking over the group.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly buys a bicycle for Adam just like the one from `Pee Wees Big Adventure. Barry and Erica turn Murrays furniture store into an after-hours lounge for college students.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits the kitchens of six restaurants that he altered when they were about to close their doors.

programme.title: Hollyoaks: Omnibus
programme.desc: Mercedes crashes Tonys fundraiser, and Donny turns to alcohol. Meanwhile, as the Osbornes continue to despair about missing Morgan, Frankie receives a message. And Peris left heartbroken.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon heads to America in a bid to rescue failing restaurant owners from imminent disaster and provide them with a recipe for success. In this first episode, Gordon visits the Hot Potato Cafe in Fishtown, Philadelphia. With no profit made in its two years of trading and an influential restaurant reviewer dubbing them `Spuddy Hell, Gordon soon realises Hot Potato may have had its chips.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon visits Flamangos in rural Whitehouse, New Jersey. Mother and daughter owners Adele and Cheryl are stuck in their tropical ways but their restaurant is far from paradise. They are in deep financial trouble and Adele struggles to get on with her staff, is disappointed by her chef and hates Gordon with a passion. Gordon has one last chance to bring them all around and make the restaurant a success.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon travels to Pasadena, California to visit a Jamaican restaurant called Cafe Kingston. There, Gordon finds Dr Una Morris, a micro-managing owner who also works as a radiotherapist in a clinic next door to the restaurant. She is determined to use hospital techniques in her kitchen and is constantly sealing everything into plastic bags. Dr Morris is as stubborn as she is proud. Can Gordon help?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Stephen Hawking comes to lecture at the university for a week, Wolowitz is given the task of maintaining his wheelchair, making Sheldon green with envy. When Sheldon begs Wolowitz to introduce him to his hero Hawking, Wolowitz takes full advantage and only agrees after making Sheldon carry out a series of humiliating tasks, including doing his laundry, cleaning his room, and taking his mother dress shopping.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon and Koothrappali throw a classy bachelor party for Wolowitz, during which some stories about the future bridegrooms colourful sexual history are accidentally revealed. When Bernadette hears about it, she becomes upset and threatens to call off the wedding. Can Wolowitz win her over with a convincing explanation and a heartfelt apology to get the nuptials back on track?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard gets caught in an argument between his mum and Bernadette while at the International Space Station. Meanwhile, Ray is feeling lonely so Sheldon invites him along to his second anniversary date with Amy.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon intervenes when he learns that Penny is thinking about breaking up with Leonard, but he is hampered by his inability to keep a secret. Meanwhile, in space, Howard is being picked on by the other astronauts.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off

programme.title: Home Alone 3
programme.desc: A quick-witted eight-year-old makes life miserable for four high-tech spies trying to recover a top-secret computer chip.

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: A cabaret singer witnesses a murder and goes undercover as a nun. In the convent, she is put in charge of coaching the choir, which she transforms into a toe-tapping rhythm group. As a result, the churchs congregation swells until even the Pope comes to witness pop classics such as `My Guy performed to glorify the Lord, but of course, her fame gives away her hiding place to the killer.

programme.title: LEGO Masters: Australia vs The World

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge takes Bart and Lisa on a weekend excursion, and when an unexpected restaurant detour awakens their taste buds, fellow foodies Amuse Bruce and Fois Garth inspire them to start their own food blog.

As Elisa develops a unique bond with her new friend, she soon learns that its fate and very survival lies in the hands of a hostile government agent and a marine biologist.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.sub-title: Cook Like a Pro: Perfect Pastry
programme.desc: Ina shares tips for cooking with sweet, savoury and even store-bought pastry; she starts with her foolproof sweet pastry dough for a French fig tart; she uses a shortcut to make spinach in puff pastry and finishes with warm goat cheese in phyllo.

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.sub-title: Cook Like a Pro: Portable Food
programme.desc: Its food on the move with Ina Garten as she shares pro tips for portable eats; she prepares a moist lemon poppy seed cake, tomato mozzarella pan bagnat, Charlie Birds farro salad with lemon dressing and fresh blueberry rhubarb jam.

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.sub-title: Cook Like a Pro: Good Grilling
programme.desc: Ina Garten shares her advice for grilling and barbecuing like a pro; to start, hot coals work their magic on her Tuscan Grilled Cornish Hens, and she amps up the flavour on Foolproof Ribs with Barbecue Sauce.

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.sub-title: Cook Like a Pro: Herbs All Ways
programme.desc: Ina is cooking with herbs and sharing tips for turning up the flavour; she incorporates rosemary, oregano and mint in pork souvlaki with radish tzatziki and pitas for dinner; dill, chives and basil shine in heirloom tomatoes with herbed ricotta.

programme.title: Nigel Slaters Simple Cooking
programme.desc: Nigel Slater looks at how spicy flavours work so well with something cooling. From a classic chicken curry to a spicy tomato stew with yoghurt, Nigel shares some of his favourite dishes, and to prove just how versatile this food pairing is, he cooks up a new version of a traditional pudding. Nigel also travels to Bristol to meet a man who is passionate about pepper.

programme.title: Nigel Slaters Simple Cooking
programme.desc: Nigel Slater continues his exploration of brilliant culinary combinations, this time turning his attention to texture. Success in the kitchen is not just about tastes and flavours; contrasting textures can really lift a dish. He makes a classic savoury pie with a puff pastry crust, and a reworking of his favourite childhood pudding: poached pears.

programme.title: James Martins Great British Adventure
programme.desc: James continues his British adventure in Lancashire with top local chef Lisa Allen in the passenger seat of his trusty red mini. Their first stop is an incredible food hall in Lisas home town of Clitheroe. Here they shop and then cook together a fantastic BBQd john dory with kohlrabi and fennel salad. Next, Lisa is in the driving seat as she takes the mini to a local buffalo farm where theyre producing some interesting cheese from buffalo milk.

programme.title: James Martins Great British Adventure
programme.desc: James adventure brings him over the border into North Wales, where hes joined by chef Stephen Terry for this leg of his journey. Their first stop is the grand Pale Hall, where head chef Gareth Stevenson is cooking up a real treat - Moroccan-inspired Welsh lamb. James offers his own variation of Welsh lamb in the grounds of the hall, serving with gnocchi and vegetables. Next, one of James boyhood dreams comes true as he has the ultimate falconry experience.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: Featuring pasties, fresh mackerel, pigeon and peas and clotted cream, all products of his beloved Cornwall.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: This edition includes happy pigs from the Isle of Wight, real cider from Somerset, peppery watercress from Hampshire streams, and Thomas Hardys favourite cheese.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: Featuring free-range geese in Leicestershire, bitter from Southwold, some delicious kippers, and free-range pork from the Suffolk Black.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: In Lancashire, Rick samples a traditional hotpot and some mouthwatering cheese, and in the Lake District he finds wild boar and the famous Herdwick sheep.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: Rick samples whelks in Bognor Regis, prepares steak and kidney pudding, explores the herbal delights of a walled garden in Sussex, and backs a campaign to save the sea bass.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: A visit to East Anglia and the Midlands, where he comes across a host of specialities, including Norfolk Black turkeys, Lincolnshire chine, speciality pork pies and the champion of British cheeses, Stilton.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: In Wakefield, Rick meets Janet Oldroyd, whose family have been harvesting rhubarb for the past four generations, and they whip up a tasty rhubarb crumble. Then in Bradford, he discovers the perfect recipe for lamb karahi at a Karachi restaurant.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: Rick and his little hairy friend, Chalky, pay a visit to Ricks favourite formal vegetable garden, at Chatsworth House. He crosses the River Severn to sample the delights of Wales, including cawl and Welsh Black cattle.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri tracks down off-the-chain chicken, starting in Salt Lake City with a unique curry-chicken mashup. In Albuquerque, NM, the chicken is down-home fried alongside sweet waffles, and in Grand Junction, CO, its nested in tacos with guacamole.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.desc: James and Stephen head south through Wales en route to Pembrokeshire. But before they get there, they stop to visit Gareth Ward and his stunning restaurant Ynyshir. After filling their bellies, they make it to the coast where James cooks up his Marloes Sands seafood parcel. Stephen tracks down Wales answer to Willy Wonka, young chocolatier Liam Burgess, who helps him make a very special one-off-chocolate bar for James.

programme.title: James Martins Great British Adventure
programme.desc: James British adventure has crossed over the Irish sea to Northern Ireland, where he is joined by his great pal and famous local chef, Paul Rankin. Their first port of call is the Giants Causeway, where James settles right in and cooks up a fish stew for the crowds of tourists. Paul goes in search of Irish gold and finds it in the form of rapeseed at the Kane family farm in Limavady.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The contestants bake rye bread rolls, ciabatta loaves and a filled centrepiece loaf that must make an impact on the table as well as on the judges.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The bakers cook saucy puds filled with a gooey filling, Marys tiramisu cake and a showstopping baked Alaska made of cake, meringue and ice cream.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The contestants bake sweet custard tarts, mini pear pies and finally a towering collection of pies from any pastry or pastries they like.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The bakers prepare yeast-leavened cakes, a Swedish princess torte and a contemporary version of the Dobos Torte. Whose `Bake Off will come to a sweet but sticky end?

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The bakers make signature savoury parcels, kouign amann and two types of showstopping doughnuts, which they hope will secure them a place in the quarter-finals.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its the quarter-finals and the remaining five are tasked with baking enriched sweet fruit loaves, an Eastern European cross between a bread and a pastry, and 36 showstopping doughnuts.

programme.title: James Martins Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Galton Blackiston, his pal and a top-class, Michelin-starred chef. They don diving suits to swim with seals, and hire an unusual mode of transport to take them around the islands. Galton visits a sea salt farm and delivers some back to James, who uses it to cook up some wonderful salt-baked sea bass. James finds an unusual restaurant situated in the middle of a post office, and finishes off the day cooking roast duck by a stunning seashore.

programme.title: James Martins Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James returns to one of his favourite places in the UK: the beautiful county of Cornwall. Joining him is his close pal and Michelin-starred chef Galton Blackiston. During their trip they discover some world-class Cornish ice cream, and Galton visits Newlyn fish market to pick up some Cornish cod. James cooks the cod along with Cornish oysters and a warm tartare sauce. They both round off the day with a painting challenge on Sennen beach, where they try out their oil painting skills.

programme.title: James Martins Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: On the next leg of his UK tour, James is joined in glorious Devon by his friend and Michelin-starred chef Simon Hulstone. James visits an extraordinary mushroom farm situated in a bungalow, and makes a tasty steak and mushroom dish. Simon samples some award-winning cheese, which inspires James to make a cheese platter fit for a king. The day ends with a trip to the Art Deco splendour of Burgh Island.

programme.title: James Martins Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by pal and Michelin-starred chef Mark Jordan, and together they set out to explore the delights of Jersey aboard mini motor bikes. James samples the delights of one of Jerseys most famous exports, the Jersey Royal potato, and he uses them to cook up a squid risotto with a difference. Mark Jordan gets a lesson in oyster shucking, and James discovers an island speciality: Jersey black butter, which he uses to create a delicious sweet treat.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris travelling with Antonia Lofaso on a culinary journey through Puerto Rico. In Old San Juan, theyre diggin into a chicken-trifongo combo; a spot in Juncos is servin up plantain-picadillo lasagna and a stew made with pigs feet.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris doubling up with sweet and savoury, both hot and cold. There are chicken and steak arepas in San Juan, Puerto Rico, winning wings from a funky food truck in Laramie, WY, and an ice cream-cake combo; a raclette-ramen mashup in Cleveland.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris worldwide journey of flavour starts in Caguas, Puerto Rico, with churrasco steak and risotto and ropa vieja dumplings. He also grabs tandoori chicken and samosas in Middleton, NJ, and next-level Filipino dishes in Cleveland.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris grabbing a little surf, turf and flavours from the earth. In Puerto Rico, a local gem is serving off-the-hook pork trifongo and shrimp empanadas. Plus, Guy finds a mushroom po boy in Somerville, NJ, and outrageous octopus in Cleveland.

programme.desc: In Claverdon, Warwickshire, Steve and Celines tatty 1960s A-frame is a neglected embarrassment. Untouched for nearly 50 years, George enlists innovative architect Graeme Williamson to help revive it.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: On the Isle of Wight, Chitty Bang Bang gets an extension, and a circus show van is converted into an ingenious home. George visits a Moroccan oasis in the Cotswolds, and seeks inspiration for a studio flat with a secret garden.

programme.title: George Clarkes Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George takes inspiration from Japan, to help Rachel and Sarah with their Victorian terrace. And have a young couple taken on too much with a listed 17th-century cottage?

programme.title: Love It or List It New Zealand
programme.desc: Alex Walls and Paul Glover help couples at odds over their homes. In West Auckland, the Jensen family are divided over their pretty but impractical property.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Keats Cottage in Shanklin on the Isle of Wight with David and Ewa Woodward. They have a past in high-end hospitality and hotel inspecting, which they hope will give them the edge in the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Jasmine House in Lutterworth, Leicestershire managed by Donna Taylor who believes in a no frills approach.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the competition is to the luxury Halliwell House in Cheshire, owned by Martin Hulme and Sara Williams where rooms have a price tag of nearly £500 a night.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Wales and Soar Chapel Guest House, which is the family home of mum and daughter duo, Lesley and Chloe Priestly. Expectations are high and Donna, in particular, is not disappointed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Its the final day in the competition and the BandB owners are meeting for the last time to find out what theyve been paid and to settle some scores.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The weeks competition is in Bristol and Bath, where the first host is 32-year-old checkout assistant Jamie-Lea. Shes hoping her flavoursome night will be enough to wow her guests.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This weeks competition is in Bristol, where the second host is 32-year-old pig farmer Chris, whos hoping to impress with a menu showing off his love of farming and Italy.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its the third night of the competition from Bristol and the turn of retired pub landlady Christine to host... with a menu that mainly seems to have come out of a packet, jar and bottle.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its the fourth night of the competition from in and around Bristol and the turn of hummus entrepreneur and local food lover James to host.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This weeks competition is in Bristol, where the fifth and final host is 50-year-old retiree and lady of leisure Shelley, whos hoping to impress with her tried and tested favourites.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Lucy and Craig hope their boutique hotel in Cambridgeshire will tick all the boxes. But their chances take a battering when one pair leave some dusty feedback.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jo and Annabel treat their guests in Stratford-upon-Avon to some Shakespearean dress-up. But the trip turns to tragedy when two guests have a sleepless night.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In North Yorkshire, busy BandBers Karen and Adrian host at their BandB-cum-shop-cum-post-office. Will their lengthy to-do list affect their chances?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The weeks final visit is to Louise and Lukes idyllic riverside pods in Norfolk. Everyones feeling serene until attention turns to the looming drama of payment day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Its been a week of tired eyes and unwanted flies. Wholl overcome their setbacks and emerge victorious on payment day?

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Thirteen-year-old cyclist Sam is rushed to AandE after coming off her bike at high speed and landing on her head. Ursula, whos 84, arrives after having a series of severe nose bleeds and paramedics are worried shes losing too much blood.

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Eighteen-year-old student George is brought to resus following a fight at a party. Consultant Phil is concerned that George may have suffered a life-threatening bleed on his brain and sends him for an urgent scan.

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a teenager with suspected meningitis, a man with diabetes and dangerously high blood sugar levels and a man with a suspected swollen artery.

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The air ambulance teams help Dennis, whos having a heart attack. A spin on her bike has catastrophic consequences for Carolyn, and theres a dramatic car crash in Norfolk.

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: Teen Mom OG
programme.desc: For four seasons fans of `Teen Mom watched Farrah, Maci, Amber and Catelynn face multiple challenges in their first years of motherhood, including such things as graduating from high school, relationships, getting jobs, beginning college and moving out on their own. Oh, and raising their first child. Now the original girls - hence, the `OG in the revived series title - return to reveal the challenges of raising children on camera, and how life in the public eye has shaped them as parents and people. Its an unprecedented view of young mothers facing the responsibilities of parenthood as their children enter kindergarten, start little league and reach other milestones of youth.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Hour
programme.sub-title: How to Get Rid of Your Wife
programme.desc: A henpecked man (Bob Newhart) tries to drive his nagging wife (Jane Withers) to murder.

programme.title: Neil Diamond ... Under a Tennessee Moon
programme.desc: The singer performs selections from his new album at the legendary Ryman Auditorium in Nashville, Tenn.; with Waylon Jennings; Chet Atkins; Beth Nielsen Chapman; Buffy Lawson; Mark OConnor.

programme.title: 42nd Street
programme.desc: Song and dance musical extravaganza telling the tale of a chorus girl who gets a spot in a Broadway production, featuring the iconic songs Were in the Money, Lullaby of Broadway, and Dames.

programme.title: Garbo: Where Did You Go?
programme.desc: An urgent, timely and compelling portrait of Hollywood icon Greta Garbo, whose fame, isolation and loneliness still captures audiences.

programme.title: ABBA: The Movie
programme.desc: Tongue-in-cheek romp following the spangle-suited Swedish superstars on a hectic tour of Australia as they are pursued by a persistent disc jockey from Sydney. The narrative is punctuated by live footage of the band in concert.

programme.title: Paul Weller: May Love Travel With You
programme.desc: ...Travel With You. New. In a stripped back set at Londons Royal Festival Hall, Paul Weller performs hits from his early career through to tracks from his 2018 solo album True Meanings.

programme.title: Record On
programme.sub-title: Record On: Paul Weller - Wild Wood
programme.desc: Record On: Paul Weller - Wild Wood: The story of Paul Wellers journey through changing times in the 90s, his new direction in sound and the resulting tour de force that is Wild Wood.

programme.title: The Jam: Live at Rockpalast
programme.desc: The Jams live performance from Dortmunds Rockpalast in 1980.

programme.title: White Riot
programme.desc: An energising film telling the story of a vital national protest movement - Rock Against Racism, formed in 1976 when a group of artists united to take on the National Front.

programme.title: Live At The Waterfront
programme.desc: Taking place at Belfasts Waterfront Hall, this landmark concert showcases Northern Irelands extensive pool of musical and artistic talent.

programme.title: The Great Songwriters
programme.desc: Series lifting the lid on the craft of song writing, with exclusive interviews and performances by acclaimed songwriters. (1 of 6)

programme.title: Discovering Music
programme.desc: A look at the rise of rock opera pioneers The Who, from their formation at school in Acton, London, to their award-winning albums and sell out tours around the world.

programme.title: Discovering Music
programme.desc: Music experts discuss the life and music of Jimi Hendrix, who wowed audiences in the 1960s with his outrageous electric guitar playing skills and his experimental sound.

programme.title: Andre Rieu: Live in Maastricht VI
programme.desc: Renowned violinist Andre Rieu performs live in concert.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.sub-title: I Like It Here in Wilmington
programme.desc: When a clothing manufacturer finds himself on the verge of bankruptcy, he ponders the idea of murdering his wife for the insurance money.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: Steve and Jane are con artists who gain access to peoples homes claiming to be doing research into polish. But eventually, they meet their match.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: Seeking a divorce from his wife, an unhappy husband hires a private eye in the hopes of catching her with another man. But things dont quite go as expected.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: When a married politician falls in love with a woman at a party, things soon go wrong and his entire career and reputation are put in jeopardy.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Hour
programme.desc: The well-to-do wife (Teresa Wright) of a bigamist will go to any lengths to have her husband all to herself.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Hour
programme.desc: A man (Leslie Nielsen) takes his son to a magic shop on his birthday and watches as the store owner makes the boy vanish.

programme.title: Discovering Film
programme.desc: A look at the life of the three-time Academy Award-winner, whose fruitful career includes acclaimed roles in `My Left Foot, Gangs of New York and There Will Be Blood.

programme.title: Discovering Film
programme.desc: A look at the life and career of the two-time Academy Award-winning star of Glory, Training Day, Malcolm X and many more acclaimed films.

programme.title: Guy Garvey: From the Vaults
programme.desc: Head back in time for a visit to 1979, with exclusive interviews and magical performances from Tina Turner, Wings, The Who and more iconic artists.

programme.title: Cream: Live at the Royal Albert Hall
programme.desc: The last appearance of the influential rock band Cream was back in 1968. In May 2005, the legendary band reunited to perform a comeback concert at Londons Royal Albert Hall.

programme.title: Eric Clapton: Across 24 Nights
programme.desc: Eric Claptons legendary 1990 and 1991 Royal Albert Hall performances, edited from the original footage and remastered in Dolby Surround Sound.

programme.title: Nothing Compares
programme.desc: Following the career of celebrated singer Sinead OConnor through her rise to fame and exploring the ways her iconoclastic personality led to exile from the pop mainstream.

programme.title: INXS: Live Baby Live
programme.desc: The group performs "Guns in the Sky," "New Sensation," "Send a Message" and other hits in concert at Wembley Stadium in London.

programme.title: Classic Albums
programme.desc: The distinct talents of five musicians produced the fourth best selling album in music history. Their personal tragedies helped craft a timeless piece of pop. This is a behind-the-scenes look at the making of `Rumours.

programme.title: The Amazing Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: The emergence of a powerful new villain and the return of an old friend bring Peter Parker to the realization that all his enemies have one thing in common: Oscorp. Based on Marvel Comics characters.

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: Adaptation of the adventures of the swinging comic-strip hero. A shy student becomes a crime fighter after a bite from a mutant spider, during a school outing, gives him extraordinary powers. As he comes to terms with his new-found abilities, he is also forced to contend with a maniac villain known as the Green Goblin.

programme.title: Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: The comic book web-slinger returns for a blockbusting sequel. Crime-fighting has cost Peter Parker his best friend and his true love Mary Jane. However, just as he quits as Spider-Man, New York comes under threat from Dr Octopus, a metal-tentacled madman. Peter has no choice but to swing back into action.

programme.title: Spider-Man 3
programme.desc: Life is sweet for Peter Parker, MJ loves him, her career is taking off and Spidey-mania is sweeping New York. However, when an alien parasite bonds to his suit, its not long before the good times and Spidey turn bad. While his ugly ego is taking centre stage, MJ is dumped from her Broadway show, Harry remembers Spider-Mans role in his fathers death, and Peter is consumed by revenge.

programme.title: The Amazing Spider-Man
programme.desc: Peter Parker finds a clue that might help him understand why his parents disappeared when he was young. His path puts him on a collision course with Dr. Curt Connors, his fathers former partner.
